Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "change condition" (#8444) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: This is fix for bug I found with PR https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8406 Expect legacy readme work when uploading package without embedded readme Without changes: legacy readme container invisable at upload package page if we upload package without embedded readme After changes: legacy readme container display when package has legacy readme No problem with embedded readme Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3507

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "change condition" (#8444) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Fix condition with readme container" (#8443) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This is fix for bug I found  with PR https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8406

Without changes: legacy readme container invisable at upload package page if we upload package without embedded readme

After changes:   legacy readme container display when package has legacy readme

No problem with embedded readme



Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3507

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Marketplace data improvement for publishers" (#8135) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/idea/566663/marketplace-data-improvement-for-publishers.html)._ ---

Hello

Is it possible to get historical data displayed for publishers - from the time the extension was published. Currently it is limited to past 180 days window, which is very limiting. Can you expand that to as much as possible.

I am primarily interested in two improvements

1. Extending the current report window (180 days). Idealy this window would be 1 year +... if not, since the very first day extension was introduced on the marketplace.

2. Ability to filter by geography - per country and continent... when this info is known. I am OK with having a pool of people who are also 'unknown' if geo info is not available.

Thanks

--- ### Original Comments #### Jane Wu [MSFT] on 5/14/2019, 01:52 AM:

Thank you for taking the time to provide your suggestion. We will do some preliminary checks to make sure we can proceed further. We'll provide an update once the issue has been triaged by the product team.

#### Mads Kristensen [MSFT] on 6/10/2019, 11:20 AM:

Your suggestion has been queued up for prioritization. Feature suggestions are prioritized based on the value to our broader developer community and the product roadmap. We may not be able to pursue this one immediately, but we will continue to monitor it up to 90 days for community input

#### Stefan Stefanov on 7/2/2019, 10:50 AM:

I also believe this would be very beneficial, as the current date is not enough to make any conclusions.

#### Gabriel Torok on 12/2/2019, 06:10 AM:

Likewise, this would be helpful for us as well.

#### Katie DeSantis on 12/2/2019, 06:32 AM:

We too would benefit from this information

#### Dan Wright on 12/2/2019, 08:44 AM:

This would be really beneficial for us too.

Thanks.

#### andre rolle on 12/2/2019, 03:35 PM:

Yes we definitely need this information to help improve our capabilities in improving how we create and published our application in visual studios marketplace.

#### andre rolle on 12/2/2019, 03:49 PM:

The management of Microsoft would change there mind in extending the 90 days to at least 1 year if possible. We as developers and others who interact with creating and publishing an application or software to visual studios marketplace. Really need this information to improve everything we do to make our app 100% functional an smooth going.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Image allowlist " (#8406) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Summary of the changes (in less than 80 characters): * check domain for most of image source * check specific path for github badge, there are security vulnerabilities if we only check the github.com domain, we are doing same behavior what VS market doing. * allow raw.github.com/ raw.githubusercontent.com/ user-images.githubusercontent.com/ camo.githubusercontent.com * replace nofollow with noopener noreferrer nofollow * nooperner open new tab for links, prevent malicious attacker from using window.opener to change the content of originating page * noreferrer similar to noopener, especially in older browsers, it make sense to use both Todo: Documentation page about allowlist that customer could refer to Warning need to be updated with reference above upload page manage package page display package page Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3507

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Updating the client libraries to 5.9" (#8442) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Finally addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8280.

Mostly brings support for `MIT-0` license in license expressions. Techincally, we only needed to update `NuGet.Packaging` to get it, but I had all client libraries updated to have their versions aligned.

Had to update some tests due to a [bugfix](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10177) in the client library.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Updating the client libraries to 5.9" (#8442) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Nuget replacement tokens not reading from AssemblyInfo class" (#10630) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: NuGet.exe

Product version: 5.9.0

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: 5.5.1

## Repro steps and/or sample project

1. Create a C# class library Project with .net framework 4.8
2. Modify `AssemblyInfo` as follows;

```
[assembly: AssemblyVersion("2.0.0.0")]
[assembly: AssemblyFileVersion("2.0.0.0")]
[assembly: AssemblyInformationalVersion("2.0.0")]
```
3. Create a `nuspec` file using below command
`nuget spec MyProject.csproj`

4. `nuspec` generated as below;

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<package >
  <metadata>
    <id>$id$</id>
    <version>$version$</version>
    <title>$title$</title>
    <authors>$author$</authors>
    <requireLicenseAcceptance>false</requireLicenseAcceptance>
    <description>$description$</description>
    <releaseNotes></releaseNotes>
    <copyright>$copyright$</copyright>
    <tags>tags1 tags2</tags>
  </metadata>
</package>
```

5. Pack with following command;

`nuget pack .\MyProject.csproj -verbosity detailed `

6. Getting an error as follows;

```
NuGet Version: 5.9.0.7134
Attempting to build package from 'MyProject.csproj'.
MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '16.4.0.56107' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Community\MSBuild\Current\bin'. Use option -MSBuildVersion to force nuget to use a specific version of MSBuild.
Packing files from 'E:\Clone\MyProject\MyProject\bin\Debug'.
Could not load file or assembly 'file:///E:\bin\nuget.exe' or one of its dependencies. Operation is not supported. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80131515)
Using 'MyProject.nuspec' for metadata.
Authors is required.
Description is required.
System.Exception: Authors is required.
Description is required.
   at NuGet.Packaging.Manifest.Validate(Manifest manifest)
   at NuGet.Packaging.Manifest.ReadFrom(Stream stream, Func`2 propertyProvider, Boolean validateSchema)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.ProjectFactory.ProcessNuspec(PackageBuilder builder, String basePath)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.ProjectFactory.CreateBuilder(String basePath, NuGetVersion version, String suffix, Boolean buildIfNeeded, PackageBuilder builder)
   at NuGet.Commands.PackCommandRunner.BuildFromProjectFile(String path)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.PackCommand.ExecuteCommand()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.ExecuteCommandAsync()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.Execute()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Program.MainCore(String workingDirectory, String[] args)
```

7. I gave values for author and description in the `nuspec` file and ran `pack` again (Given in `AssemblyInfo` but it's not replacing the tokens)

```
NuGet Version: 5.9.0.7134
Attempting to build package from 'MyProject.csproj'.
MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '16.4.0.56107' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Community\MSBuild\Current\bin'. Use option -MSBuildVersion to force nuget to use a specific version of MSBuild.
Packing files from 'E:\Clone\MyProject\MyProject\bin\Debug'.
Could not load file or assembly 'file:///E:\bin\nuget.exe' or one of its dependencies. Operation is not supported. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80131515)
Using 'MyProject.nuspec' for metadata.
Add file 'E:\Clone\MyProject\MyProject\bin\Debug\MyProject.dll' to package as 'lib\net48\MyProject.dll'
Found packages.config. Using packages listed as dependencies

Id: MyProject
Version: 1.0.0
Authors: AA
Description: AA
Tags: tags1, tags2
Dependencies: log4net [2.0.12, ), Microsoft.ReportingServices.ReportViewerControl.Winforms [150.1440.0, ), Microsoft.SqlServer.Types [14.0.1016.290, ), System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe [5.0.0, ), System.Windows.Interactivity.WPF [2.0.20525, ), Unity [5.11.10, )

Added file '[Content_Types].xml'.
Added file '_rels/.rels'.
Added file 'MyProject.nuspec'.
Added file 'lib/net48/MyProject.dll'.
Added file 'package/services/metadata/core-properties/3e75407b72454e6eb1bcbe849f8fcc10.psmdcp'.

WARNING: NU5128: Some target frameworks declared in the dependencies group of the nuspec and the lib/ref folder do not have exact matches in the other location. Consult the list of actions below:
- Add a dependency group for .NETFramework4.8 to the nuspec
Successfully created package 'E:\Clone\MyProject\MyProject\MyProject.1.0.0.nupkg'.
```

8. Now `nupkg` created but always with version 1.0.0, the error I've noticed is `Could not load file or assembly 'file:///E:\bin\nuget.exe' or one of its dependencies. Operation is not supported. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80131515)`. This somehow ignores the metadata tokens replaced from `AssemblyInfo`
9. Tested with 5.7, 5.8.1 as well, same result but 5.5.1 works fine

### Verbose Logs

```
NuGet Version: 5.9.0.7134
Attempting to build package from 'MyProject.csproj'.
MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '16.4.0.56107' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Community\MSBuild\Current\bin'. Use option -MSBuildVersion to force nuget to use a specific version of MSBuild.
Packing files from 'E:\Clone\MyProject\MyProject\bin\Debug'.
Could not load file or assembly 'file:///E:\bin\nuget.exe' or one of its dependencies. Operation is not supported. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80131515)
Using 'MyProject.nuspec' for metadata.
Authors is required.
Description is required.
System.Exception: Authors is required.
Description is required.
   at NuGet.Packaging.Manifest.Validate(Manifest manifest)
   at NuGet.Packaging.Manifest.ReadFrom(Stream stream, Func`2 propertyProvider, Boolean validateSchema)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.ProjectFactory.ProcessNuspec(PackageBuilder builder, String basePath)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.ProjectFactory.CreateBuilder(String basePath, NuGetVersion version, String suffix, Boolean buildIfNeeded, PackageBuilder builder)
   at NuGet.Commands.PackCommandRunner.BuildFromProjectFile(String path)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.PackCommand.ExecuteCommand()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.ExecuteCommandAsync()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.Execute()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Program.MainCore(String workingDirectory, String[] args)
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "native assets in subfolders are not respected" (#10629) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
---
**Issue moved from dotnet/sdk#16211**
- Please respond to @stevenbrix.

---

_From @stevenbrix on Thursday, March 4, 2021 6:39:41 PM_

If you have a NuGet package with native assets in subfolders:

```
runtimes\win10-x86\native\foo.dll
runtimes\win10-x86\native\en-us\foo.dll.mui
```

The .NET SDK copies these to the same location, and you lose the `en-us` locale subfolder.  This happens with both `Build` and `Publish` targets.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Tab ordering for the project grid's Version and Installed column headers is incorrect" (#10627) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

In the Solution PMUI, the projects grid's Version and Installed column headers have their tab ordering reversed. The Version column appears first but when tabbing through, keyboard focus goes from the Checkbox to Project to Installed to Version columns. It should go Checkbox -> Project -> Version -> Installed.

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe): Visual Studio

Product version: 16.10 Preview 2.0

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: Don't know

## Repro steps and/or sample project

Open the Solution PMUI, select a package to populate the details pane, then tab through the UI controls until you get to the Project grid. Tab through the grid columns and notice the tab ordering of the column headers: Checkbox -> Project -> Installed -> Version but the columns appear in the order Checkbox, Project, Version, Installed.

### Verbose Logs

N/A

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add a new dotnet sign at src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.CommandLine.XPlat/Commands/Signing/SignCommand.cs" (#10619) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Note that this new command should perform similar input validation as the existing NuGet.exe sign command at src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.CommandLine/Commands/SignCommand.cs. For example, some option combinations are invalid/required.
Because the argument can expand to multiple packages, the new sign command must support multiple packages. (I think the spec has a typo in that the sign usage example should show ...* as the verify command does.) SignArgs.PackagePath should be deprecated in favor of a new IReadOnlyList PackagePaths property.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Check formats of certificate used for signing cross all platforms" (#10626) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Check formats of certificate used for signing cross all platforms. 
e.g. .pfx (used on Windows), .pem (used on Linux)
Check if we support the formats according to document, and according the code. Check if there is any inconsistency.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add unit tests to check if argument parsing is correct for dotnet nuget sign command" (#10623) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We had [NuGetSignCommandTest.cs](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/test/NuGet.Clients.Tests/NuGet.CommandLine.Test/NuGetSignCommandTest.cs) to test if the argument parsing is correct in the NuGet.exe sign command.
Since we have different code for argument parsing between NuGet.exe sign and dotnet.exe nuget sign, we need to have the equivalent tests for dotnet.exe nuget sign.

We need to: Create tests in \test\NuGet.Core.FuncTests\NuGet.XPlat.FuncTest\XplatSignTests.cs, tests if the argument combinations are parsed correctly.

This might be difficult as it's not as easy as nuget cli to get the parsed arguments to verify.

But other xplat command (e.g. sources add/list etc.), we add tests into dotnet.integration.tests (functional tests) to test the argument parsing.
So we might have to do that if unit tests are difficult to add.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add more unit tests in SignCommandRunner" (#10622) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The existing tests in [SignCommandRunnerTests](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/test/NuGet.Core.Tests/NuGet.Commands.Test/SignCommandRunnerTests.cs) test only exceptions and error cases.
We need to expand SignCommandRunnerTests to verify different options on all platforms with following positive tests.

- When the certificate is a file path.
- When the certificate is in a certificate store.
- When the certificate is password-protected.

After checking, the certificate used in current SignCommandRunnerTests doesn't have private key, so it won't work for positive cases ( it's okey to use that for negative cases).  
For password-protected case, we test when --interactive is false.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add functional tests in dotnet.integrated.tests for dotnet nuget sign, and verify on all platforms" (#10621) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Exit code, output, errors, etc. for argument validation failures.
With valid arguments the command creates a good, signed package.

The tests will need two fixtures: one for patching dotnet and another for setting up CA, TSA for signing.
Some other infrastructures might also need to be set up. e.g. https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/test/NuGet.Clients.Tests/NuGet.CommandLine.Test/MockServer.cs

Refactoring or duplicating might be needed (project NuGet.Clients.Tests targets only to net472, which is not applicable for dotnet.integration.tests) to make the tests to be added into dotnet.integration.tests be able to use the following:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/test/NuGet.Clients.Tests/NuGet.CommandLine.Test/MockServer.cs
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/test/TestUtilities/Test.Utility/TestServer/PortReserver.cs
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/test/NuGet.Clients.Tests/NuGet.CommandLine.Test/PortReserver.cs

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Dotnet nuget sign : Respect the --interactive option. " (#10620) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Note that the option has flipped from NuGet.exe's -NonInteractive option.

See all comments in NuGet/NuGet.Client#3069.
Propagating the NonInteractive option from SignArgs in SignCommandRunner seems like the best option.
If the default behavior must change as a result of this work, please sync with Claire Novotny.
It may be worth adding a test for the non-interactive case. The test may actually be provided by a later task below.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Move the MSBuild detecting logic to a library different than NuGet.Commandline" (#5886) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue " [Request] install command should install with v3 folder layout" (#10593) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
As noted here https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/10579 the install command lacks the ability to install the package in the v3 folder layout.

**Expected result:**

Every command nuget CLI has to offer should be ported to the new v3 layout, either by re-defining the "default" behaviour or by giving an additional argument to change the behvaviour.

I would suggest that every command should behave identically regarding the v3 layout, so all commands should default to v3 layout or give an argument, from a consumer point of view currently it seems half-baked where some commands do v3 layout while others don't.

**Actual result:**

The `install` command doesn't "respect" the new folder layout and still uses the "old" layout, while other commands like `add` already do the "new" layout.

I lack the knowledge if the `install` command is the only command which uses the "old" layout.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Wrongly resolved transitive references with centrally managed package versions" (#10578) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "The NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021" (#53) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The current NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021. If you validate that packages are repository signed by NuGet.org using a [NuGet client policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/consume-packages/installing-signed-packages), the [`NuGet.exe verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-verify) command, or the [`dotnet nuget verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-nuget-verify) command, you will need to take steps by March 15th, 2021 to avoid disruptions when installing packages from NuGet.org signed with the new certificate. 

If you are unsure if you will be impacted or want to see instructions to allow the new certificate, please see our blogpost on the matter: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/the-nuget-org-repository-signing-certificate-will-be-updated-as-soon-as-march-15th-2021/

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Still have NuGet Restore Issues on Debian 10" (#51) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The isssue seems to be marked as resolved #49 but i'm still facing the same issue on Debian 10.
```
  Determining projects to restore...
```
